simpledb

Class Operator

  • java.lang.Object
    • simpledb.Operator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, DbIterator
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Aggregate, Delete, Filter, HashEquiJoin, Insert, Join, OrderBy, Project

    public abstract class Operator
extends java.lang.Object
implements DbIterator
    Abstract class for implementing operators. It handles close, next and hasNext. Subclasses only need to implement open and readNext.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • fetchNext

        protected abstract Tuple fetchNext()
                            throws DbException,
                                   TransactionAbortedException
        Returns the next Tuple in the iterator, or null if the iteration is finished. Operator uses this method to implement both next and hasNext.
        Returns:
        the next Tuple in the iterator, or null if the iteration is finished.
        Throws:
        DbException
        TransactionAbortedException

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes this iterator. If overridden by a subclass, they should call super.close() in order for Operator's internal state to be consistent.
        Specified by:
        close in interface DbIterator

      • open

        public void open()
          throws DbException,
                 TransactionAbortedException
        Description copied from interface: DbIterator
        Opens the iterator. This must be called before any of the other methods.
        Specified by:
        open in interface DbIterator
        Throws:
        DbException - when there are problems opening/accessing the database.
        TransactionAbortedException

      • getChildren

        public abstract DbIterator[] getChildren()
        Returns:
        return the children DbIterators of this operator. If there is only one child, return an array of only one element. For join operators, the order of the children is not important. But they should be consistent among multiple calls.

      • setChildren

        public abstract void setChildren(DbIterator[] children)
        Set the children(child) of this operator. If the operator has only one child, children[0] should be used. If the operator is a join, children[0] and children[1] should be used.
        Parameters:
        children - the DbIterators which are to be set as the children(child) of this operator

      • getTupleDesc

        public abstract TupleDesc getTupleDesc()
        Description copied from interface: DbIterator
        Returns the TupleDesc associated with this DbIterator.
        Specified by:
        getTupleDesc in interface DbIterator
        Returns:
        return the TupleDesc of the output tuples of this operator

      • getEstimatedCardinality

        public int getEstimatedCardinality()
        Returns:
        The estimated cardinality of this operator. Will only be used in lab6

      • setEstimatedCardinality

        protected void setEstimatedCardinality(int card)
        Parameters:
        card - The estimated cardinality of this operator Will only be used in lab6
